summary:
Jesus was crucified in first-century Rome's Judaea, likely in AD 30 or 33. This means he was nailed to a wooden cross and killed. It's a significant event in Christian belief.

According to the Bible, Jesus was arrested, tried, and sentenced by Pontius Pilate. He was then crucified by the Romans. During the crucifixion, soldiers offered him a drink and gambled for his clothes. Jesus died around 3 p.m., and a soldier confirmed his death by piercing his side.

This event is known as the Passion and is crucial in Christian teachings about salvation.
title: Crucifixion of Jesus
